attributes.action: Reform Private Member's Bill procedure so that an objection needs to be seconded
attributes.background: Evidenced today; Friday 15th June 2018, a Private Members Bill was objected to by a lone MP. The Private Members Bill process allows for Bills to be introduced by MPs and Lords who are not government ministers, furthering the democratic process. The objection by one MP hinders that process.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is to request that parliamentary procedures be modernised. When an opportunity arises where an MP may object to a reading of a Private Bill or Private Member Bill, any objection must be seconded by another MP for it to be recognised. This change will allow for the democratic process to represent the electorate without it being compromised by a lone voice.

attributes.action: Ban all cold calling by phone in the UK
attributes.background: Absolutely sick and tired of cold calls - accidents, insurance, investments, PPI
attributes.additional_details: Too numerous to note and all of UK is suffering.

attributes.action: Provide training to all NHS GP's and Health Visitors on the baby and child sleep
attributes.background: To provide all NHS GP's and Health visitors with an accurate basic knowledge on baby and child sleep. Sleep deprivation is one of the biggest causes of mental health problems in parents and the advice given is very mixed, inaccurate and could cause families more harm.
attributes.additional_details:
GP's and Health Visitors all seem to have different ideas on baby and child sleep. This ranges from:
How much sleep they should have,
When they should wake from their last nap,
Starting solids to get babies to sleep,
Using Piriton (drugging them),
Letting them cry themselves to sleep,
Assuming all babies and children will just fall asleep when they are tired,
Cutting naps from already sleep deprived infants,
Yes, I have heard all of these. Science and research needs to be taken into account now.

attributes.action: Cut Overseas Aid budget by 50% & give £7bn saved to NHS, rather than more taxes.
attributes.background: UK commits to UN target that each country gives 0.7% of GNI (Gross National Income) for Overseas Aid. Only 6 (inc UK) of the 28 participants achieve target - average for all is 0.30% - (OECD 2015). UK pays c10% of total - ie £14bn of £140bn. As NHS is in need, £7bn could save it. Charity at home!
attributes.additional_details:
Source 2015 OECD.

The other 5 countries hitting the target are: Netherlands, Denmark, Luxembourg, Norway and Sweden - all relatively small economies, with positive attitudes to aid.  

The other members of the G8 seem to have an alternative attitude: USA 0.17%, Japan 0.22%, Russia 0%, Canada 0.28%, Italy 0.21%, Germany 0.52%, France 0.37%.

If we went to half of what we currently pay, we'd still be achieving 0.35%; still more than all other G8 members apart from Germany and, marginally, France.

attributes.action: Ban horse racing
attributes.background: Horses are whipped and forced to run around tracks that are often made of hard-packed dirt at speeds of more than 30 miles per hour while carrying people on their backs. Racehorses are the victims of a multibillion-dollar industry that has problems with drug abuse, injuries and race fixing.
attributes.additional_details: When they stop winning races or become injured, some owners don’t want to pay for a horse who doesn’t bring in any money. Many end up in slaughterhouses where they are turned into dog food and glue. They may endure days of transport in tiny trailers where there is no access to water, food and injuries are common. Horses tend to thrash about in order to avoid being shot by the gun, which is supposed to render them unconscious before their throats are cut.

attributes.action: Make it law that it is reported to the police when a cat is knocked down.
attributes.background: Unlike the current laws regarding dogs, it is NOT required to report the knocking down of a cat. Not only is it unfair, but also cruel. A cat has as much right as a dog, however, they are not given the same kindness and protection of the current laws of our lands.

attributes.action: Issue an official apology to Lauren Southern for denial of entry into the UK
attributes.background:
Lauren Southern was detained in Calais by Kent police and charged under section 7 of the terrorism act, before being denied entry into the UK.

The Government must apologise for this.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that that section 7 was wrongfully applied as Section 41 states that "A constable may arrest without a warrant a person whom he reasonably suspects to be a terrorist." I do not believe that the police believed Lauren Southern to be a terrorist.

attributes.action: Include teaching ‘self examination’ in health/sex education in schools.
attributes.background: Having been diagnosed with breast cancer ive learnt that early detection really does save lives.How many truly check and know their bodies?In school we are taught sex ed/hygiene. Teaching to routinely self examine the correct way in this lesson would bring body awareness and in turn early detection
attributes.additional_details: My intention with this petition is that if self examination is introduced to the health/sex Education curriculum then self checking would become part of our daily lives and routines like washing/cleaning teeth/wearing deodorant. ..whilst in the shower we check ourselves. Right now we don’t all do it because we weren’t taught too from a young age and it’s not routine. This needs to change and be taught in schools, early detection does save lives it is so important to know your body!

attributes.action: Be commited to holding a second referendum on Scottish independence after Brexit
attributes.background: I am asking the UK government to be committed to holding a second referendum on Scottish Independence, because it looks like we are heading towards a hard Brexit, which could damaging to the UK and Scottish economies in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
And also here is a list of things she plans to and/or could do do to Scotland:

- take Scotland out of the EU against its will, despite voting overwhelmingly to remain. 
- remove powers from the Scottish Parliament after Brexit. 
- they could close down the parliament and rip up the devolution settlement. 
- wipe out the SNP and other parties completely for good in Scotland. 
- sell Scotland down the river.
The prime minister must regard this as a ‘power grab’ if this is likely to happen.

attributes.action: After Brexit - Expats spouses should be allowed to live in the UK without a visa
attributes.background: After the Brexit, British expats should be able to bring our partners/wifes/husbands who are not British to live in the UK without a visa (as in the past being in Europe).
attributes.additional_details: With the current deal for Brexit, if you want to move back, we can get passports for our children but not our wifes or husbands. Our wifes and husbands should be given freedom of movement as our children do. We are families, we shouldn’t be split apart.

attributes.action: Create a voluntary, opt-in, monthly payment that goes 100% to the NHS
attributes.background: Recently, my 2 year old daughter has been suffering from a health condition that we are still looking into. Without the NHS, the treatment my daughter has received and is still yet to receive would have cost me tens of thousands of pounds that I simply could not afford. We all depend on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, the taxes we pay are used to fund numerous different categories including international services, culture and religion to name a few as well as the NHS. All of this information can be found on the .gov website. This proposal would be an additional, voluntary payment that would go solely to fund the NHS.
 
As members of the public, we are quick enough to comment that the NHS needs more funding and investment, this option would put the ball in our court. Something needs to change.

attributes.action: To keep the RAF Red Arrows in Lincolnshire after RAF Scampton closes.
attributes.background: The Red Arrows have been in lincoln for years . It's there home and alot of people would agree they should stay in lincoln as that is one of the know facts of lincoln .

attributes.action: To stop companies selling debts to debt collection companies
attributes.background: Want it so companies eg mobile phone companies can’t sell a debt on to debt companies who then add extortionate charges and use heavy handed tactics. The contract is between the company and the person who takes out the contract, making that contract a legal document.

attributes.action: Add teaching of CPR and basic lifesaving skills to the teaching syllabus
attributes.background: Many lives could potentially be saved if more individuals within the U.K. knew how to correctly carry out CPR and had the knowledge of basic lifesaving skills. Include these topics in the primary & secondary national curriculum to save thousands of lives.

attributes.action: Give English constituencies a referendum on creating an English Parliament
attributes.background: Voters in English constituencies want the creation of a secular single chamber English Parliament elected separately from Westminster and located outside of London. This will address the democratic deficit experienced by English voters and give us English votes for English laws.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all drivers and bikers to have an onboard camera
attributes.background: My husband was killed in May 2017 while he was doing 15mph on his motorbike. We have never had answers as to what happened that day. There we're 3 other vehicles involved and all statements were different. I feel if they had cameras we would have answers.

attributes.action: Repeal the EU Copyright Directive, when the UK leaves the EU.
attributes.background: The EU has just passed, Articles 11 and 13 of the EU Copyright Directive. This could damage and threaten people's right to freedom of speech and expression online, fair use and censor political and peaceful conversation. This should be repealed from UK law on the UK's exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Ban the Nazi salute in the UK
attributes.background: The Nazi salute is an insult to those who fought and died for peace during World War Two. Therefore it should be banned in the UK because it offends the Jewish community.

attributes.action: Vaccinate all children against Chickenpox
attributes.background: The last four days I have watched my two daughters scream in agony as their Chickenpox became itchy and painful. People presuppose Chickenpox is a mild infection but that is not always the case. It is about time that we eliminated this illness and added it to the childhood immunisation schedule.
attributes.additional_details:
It is assumed that Chickenpox is a mild virus that does not require vaccination. However, this is not always the case and secondary infection can result which can lead to hospital admission and even fatality. The NHS website outlines this in more clinical detail. Another important factor is the sheer anguish and suffering of those who catch it. Chickepox is very itchy and painful and most children find it extremely distressing. When a vaccine is available, would we not choose to eliminate this suffering?
In other countries such as the US and Australia, a vaccine is offered as part of the childhood immunisation schedule. Let us not let cost stop us eliminating this horrible illness once and for all.

attributes.action: Give children under the age 18 the right to 10 days education free a year
attributes.background: I am a mother of a child recently starting the educational cycle, hoping for children's attendance to be the right of the parents, rather than the school having the final say in what our children can and cannot do. Hope I have opened people's eyes and can make a change.
attributes.additional_details: It is acceptable for a school to exclude a child for 2 weeks for bad behaviour, however it is not acceptable for parents to take a child on holiday for 7 days. These are our own children we are raising, It is a right of the parents to have the final say with attendance, with input from the educational side -  Not the other way around.  Please sign this petition and change the education system for families to better the lives of their children. Many endless thanks.

attributes.action: A commemorative plaque for the contributions made by the Windrush Generation.
attributes.background: As a result of the recent  negative treatment of the Windrush Generation,   we should instead  acknowledge their invaluable contributions to the successes of British life over the years.

attributes.action: Ban all non-biodegradable plastic used within the fashion industry
attributes.background: There are estimated 12.7 million tonnes of plastic ends up in the ocean every year. This waste releases toxins, absorbed by animals, subsequently entering the food chain. A ban on non-biodegradable plastic from the fashion industry could limit the micro-plastics that end up in the ocean.
attributes.additional_details:
- Greenpeace (2018). Ocean Plastic. Available at: https://www.greenpeace.org.uk/what-we-do/oceans/plastics/ (Accessed: 30 April 2018).
- Kozlowski, A., Bardecki, M. & Searcy, C., 2012. Environmental Impacts in the Fashion Industry: A Life-cycle and Stakeholder Framework. The Journal of Corporate Citizenship, (45), pp.17–36.
- Seltenrich, N., 2015. New link in the food chain? Marine plastic pollution and seafood safety. Environmental health perspectives, 123(2), pp.A34–41.

attributes.action: Make banks directly responsible for contacting those who have been missold PPI
attributes.background: Banks and credit card companies place the onus on individuals to seek out whether they have had PPI, yet they hold this information and it is readily available to them.  The responsibility should rest with the companies who have missold to make all efforts to trace their victims and make recompense.
attributes.additional_details: Banks hold the information in their systems and files as to who had PPI.  Those most likely to need the compensation are possibly least able to pursue a claim.  Why should individuals have to possibly employ companies who gain financially from their loss or try to remember historical financial contracts?  Now the government has put a deadline for claiming.  Before that deadline banks should make every reasonable effort to trace those who have had PPI making it easier for them to pursue a claim.

attributes.action: Enhanced Maternity / Paternity Benefits for Employees of Large Corporations
attributes.background: I wish for it to be made a legal requirement for large corporate companies who employee over 50,000 employees to pay enhanced Maternity / Paternity benefits as some industry leaders already do. The gap between the government minimum&some industry leaders is outstanding eg. Ford pay 52 weeks full pay
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was lucky enough to fall pregnant&welcome my first child in to the world. Before I did so, I was completely unaware of the difference between the maternity / paternity packages that different large organisations had in place. The difference between you and another Mum / Dad might be in excess of thousands of pounds which makes a huge different to any working family. I propose for all large organisations to pay the same, enhanced package rather than the government minimum guideline.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people living with heart conditions
attributes.background: Coronary heart disease remains the number 1 killer in the UK. Every 7 minutes someone in the UK will have a heart attack and 800,000 people are living with heart failure every year. Despite this heart patients still have to pay for medication which is not affordable for everyone.

attributes.action: Offer African languages from across the continent as formally recognised GCSEs
attributes.background: There are over 15 modern languages offered as a GCSE, however none of the languages offered cover countries across the African continent.
attributes.additional_details:
According the the 2011 census 1.8% of the UK population are Black African and that is set to grow, therefore children of Black African descent should be given the opportunity to achieve a modern language GCSE in their mother tongue.

http://www.voice-online.co.uk/article/2011-census-british-africans-now-dominant-black-group

https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/up-a-third-uk-population-3500561

attributes.action: Make calls to the Police non-emergency number 101 free.
attributes.background: Calls to 999 are free, but often these are not urgent. Calls to the NHS 111 are free. The public are encouraged (quite rightly) to report crimes, but are discouraged by the cost. If the Police want the public to report more crimes, and to reduce non-urgent 999 calls, 101 should be a free service.

attributes.action: State categorically that Canada has our support in its spat with Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: At a time when Britain is leaving the EU and restrengthening our links with our Commonwealth friends, why have we turned our back on Canada during their assault by Saudi Arabia? We share a monarchy and history, so an attack on Canada is also an attack on us and our way of life.
attributes.additional_details: We should back Canada fully against Saudi Arabia and show them that they are not alone in standing up for human rights in the world. Cowardice and arms sales should never come before long term friends and relations. Many of us have family members in Canada and our history goes back all the way. How embarrassing that our government has put money before pride, morality and friends.

attributes.action: Bring back our job center to Darwen
attributes.background: Bring back our job center to Darwen which closed early this year without even asking the people of darwen if this was ok
attributes.additional_details:
UNEMPLOYED people in parts of East Lancashire will face extra 10 mile round-trips after the Department of Work and Pensions announced it will merge two jobcentres with nearby sites.

As a result of an estates review by the DWP, jobcentres in Green Street, Darwen, and Market Street, Colne, will now be axed.

attributes.action: Recoup NHS treatment costs from anyone convicted of domestic violence offences.
attributes.background: My plan would be to use the U.K. Courts system to recoup the costs of treating domestic violence victims by applying an additional financial penalty (to anyone convicted of domestic violence) that fully covers the costs of any NHS treatment that arises as a result of a person’s criminal act.
attributes.additional_details:
Every year, it is estimated, that it costs the NHS approximately £5.5 billions Sterling to treat victims of domestic violence.Please See link below.
https://www.trustforlondon.org.uk/news/domestic-violence-costs-55bn-year-england/
Surely these NHS treatment costs could be recouped from anyone convicted of an offence of domestic violence or abuse by using the U.K Law Courts to apply an additional financial penalty to perpetrators of domestic violence offences?

attributes.action: Make employers offer part-time working for new parents
attributes.background: Lots of parents who worked full time before having children are unable to do so once the child is born. At present employers are allowed to consider part-time options but they do not have to honour them leaving new mums and dads no option but to resign. The same job level should also be available.
attributes.additional_details: Returning to a role after having a baby is difficult enough, it seems that if you want part-time you have to fight for it and if it is granted the job level you were at before is not always made available to you. I believe that it should be compulsory to offer a part time role at the same level. Parents should not be penalised in the workplace for having a child.

attributes.action: Prohibit filibustering and similar forms of sabotage to the democratic process.
attributes.background: Certain MPs have been subverting democracy by using filibustering and other procedural technicalities to prevent reasoned intellectual debate of bills in the House of Commons. This is an affront to the parliamentary process and brings our country’s politics into disrepute.

attributes.action: Please keep our Island Studio school OPEN in East Cowes Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
Do NOT CLOSE this school. 
If the current proprietors cannot or will not continue running it, then allow SOMEONE ELSE to run it.
We need diversity of opportunity.
But start at a lower age so children can choose to go to have their full secondary education at this school. Make it 11-19, not 14-19.

attributes.action: Ensure money raised from new sugar levy is divided between education and the NHS
attributes.background:
The Government recently introduced the sugar levy on soft drinks to try and tackle the growing problem of obesity in the UK. The legislation doesn’t specify where the money raised should be spent.
We would like legislation created to ensure that any money raised is given to the NHS and to education
attributes.additional_details: The levy on soft drinks is expected to raise over £274 million pounds which could be used to help fund the struggling NHS budget and also fund sport activities for school children.

attributes.action: Repeal the 1997 handgun amendment act & legalise conceal-carry.
attributes.background: The signatories of this petition want to see handguns, rifles & shotguns treated like any other dangerous tool; available to law-abiding citizens in the same way cars are; with licensing & training to all who desire them for self-defence. The time has come.

attributes.action: Male & Female employees should be treated the same when on shared parental leave
attributes.background:
Because of the Equality Act 2010 woman and men should have the same company benefits as equal pay.
At the moment companies can offer a enhanced maternity pay that benefits only women can opt not to offer the same benefits to male employees wanting to take Shared Paternal Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment there isn't any legal requirement, with some cases people making a claim that they are being treated less favourable than women on the same company and/or job, some being successful and some not.
Some companies use the technicality that male employee on shared parental leave is treated no less favourably than a female employee on shared parental leave while they offer enhaced maternity pay a benefit only available to womans.

attributes.action: Ban the use of slug pellets in the UK.
attributes.background: Many pesticides are potentially dangerous to hedgehogs and slug pellets are no exception.  Hedgehogs may eat the pellets, and they are very likely to eat the poisoned slugs and snails. As hedgehogs are an endangered species, pellets should be banned in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Hedgehogs are continuing to decline in the UK, according to a new report.Surveys by citizen scientists show hedgehog numbers have fallen by up to 95% since the turn of the century.
Conservation groups say they are particularly concerned about the plight of the hedgehog in towns and rural areas.Slug pellets contribute to this number.Hedgehogs are an endangered species we must do all we can to help these mammals.
There are many natural ways to curb slugs without the need for dangerous pellets.

attributes.action: Allow the public to carry and use self defence items.
attributes.background: Request that in light of significant police cuts, a steep the increase in violent crime, and a reduction in detection and convictions for violent crime, that citizens be permitted to defend themselves against attackers without fear of prosecution.
attributes.additional_details: To this end, we request that for as long as the current criminal climate exists, that we be permitted to carry items that can be used for, and are intended for self defence, such as night sticks, batons, pepper spray as well as other non lethal items. We feel that the need to adequately defend ourselves and our families becomes a basic right when the police and judicial system are unable to fulfil that duty as is the case at present.

attributes.action: All chewing gum sold in the UK from 2023 must be easy to remove from paths.
attributes.background: Chewing gum defaces public paths, blocks toilets and damages clothes, and cleaning costs a huge amount. This proposal gives manufacturers a realistic time to improve their formula.
attributes.additional_details: The LGA estimates the annual cost of removing pieces trodden into pavements across England has reached £56 million, with around six tons dropped in the West End of London alone each year. It claimed that while the average piece of gum costs about 3p to buy, local authorities have to spend around £1.50 to clean it up. (This estimate: 22 Nov 2014)

attributes.action: Ban the sale of disposable BBQs in the UK
attributes.background:
Disposable BBQs are bad for the environment in terms of use & disposal

Are made using unsustainable materials from tropical forests in South Africa and South America
Can't be recycled
Burn the grass & typically result it scattered litter
Local residents are unable to open windows
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.hackneycitizen.co.uk/2018/03/21/hackney-council-cracks-down-bbqs-london-fields/

http://news.hackney.gov.uk/london-fields-disposable-barbecue-ban

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/3666716/Is-it-worth-it-Disposable-barbecues.html

attributes.action: Scrap PSPOs that give authorities the power to displace or fine homeless people.
attributes.background: Despite updated Home Office guidance at the start of the year, which instructs councils not to target people for being homeless and sleeping rough, the Guardian has found over 50 local authorities with public space protection orders (PSPOs) in place
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/may/20/homeless-people-fined-imprisoned-pspo-england-wales
Homeless people are banned from town centres, routinely fined hundreds of pounds and even sent to prison for some repeat offenses. Local authorities in England and Wales have issued hundreds of fixed-penalty notices and pursued criminal convictions for “begging”, “persistent and aggressive begging” and “loitering” since being given strengthened powers to combat antisocial behaviour in 2014.

attributes.action: Cut the foreign aid budget by 50% and use this money to save the NHS
attributes.background: Our NHS is in crisis and needs urgent investment. This money would allow for more facilities to be built, more training and recruitment of doctors and nurses, more research and extra mental health provisions. Also, as people are living longer the NHS needs more facilities to help the elderly.
attributes.additional_details: Multiple reports from healthcare experts, RCN, news reports etc all point to our NHS being at breaking point.

attributes.action: Allow RSPCA to seize animals that they believe to be in danger
attributes.background:
The police have to be there for the RSPCA to seize an animal, because of this it is a lot of time wasted for the Police force. 

RSPCA are educated on these situations and should be allowed to go ahead and take any animal they believe to be in danger without the authorities.
attributes.additional_details: Not being able to take an animal that is in danger can cause harm to the animal and sometimes this becomes fatal and there will be a court case, which also is a lot of wasted money when it could have been avoided.

attributes.action: Utility companies to be responsible for repairing potholes around poor repairs
attributes.background: A majority of potholes form around places of existing weakness, such as road repair works following companies digging up the roads for routine maintenance.  These companies should be responsible for filling any potholes that are a consequence of a road weakness following their actions
attributes.additional_details:
Potholes are caused when water penetrates cracks in the road. When this water freezes, it expands, widening the cracks. When it melts, traffic smashes new craters into the road surface.  Other countries do not have many drains and services under their roads, and do not give privatised utility companies the right to dig up a new road
An increasing number of road users are taking legal action. The AA estimates that the cost to insurers of claims (pothole damage) was £2.85m during February alone.

attributes.action: Parliament rule out National Parks and AONBs as sites for nuclear waste disposal
attributes.background: MPs approved a new plan for the UK’s most toxic radioactive materials. The move means protected areas like national parks and areas of outstanding natural beauty (AONB) would be potential sites for waste disposal facilities. We MUST have parliament rule out our national treasures as a dumping ground
attributes.additional_details:
After efforts to find a home for the UK’s nuclear waste stalled, the government launched a new strategy that has since undergone scrutiny by the Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS) Committee. After hearing evidence from key stakeholders, the committee has released a report in which they refuse to rule out protected areas as potential dumping sites. - Josh Gabbatiss, Science Correspondent for the Independent.

Ruth Bradshaw, CNP’s policy and research manager, said: “The decision not to recommend excluding national parks and AONBs as possible locations also goes against the government’s ambitions for these areas as set out in the 25-year environment plan."

attributes.action: Convert the Charter of Fundamental Rights into UK law for if Brexit happens.
attributes.background: The Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union is important to everybody. It gives people a voice to be heard. The Charter of Rights needs to be converted into UK law after leaving EU so that our rights as humans are fully protected both at home and abroad.
attributes.additional_details:
EU Charter of Rights gives access to proper justice and proper freedom for all without partiality. The UK has had a good history on human rights and protection for its citizens both at home and abroad.

Remember important rights like that of education and healthcare do not exist in UK law they are from the Charter and just a small example of why it is vital that it is retained at UK law in the even of our withdrawal from the EU

attributes.action: Change 30 free hour childcare to a monthly sign-up and not a term sign-up.
attributes.background: Parents who get a full time job need to then put their child into care immediately, so need the support immediately and not on a term by term basis, you can't sign up when you don't have a job but when you do, you have to wait until the new term starts. If this was monthly it would make sense.

attributes.action: Pass a law requiring NHS Trusts to release patient records within 21 days
attributes.background: Currently, there are significant variations between NHS trusts as to how long they will take to release patient records when requested. We, the undersigned, call on the government to standardise this in law to 21 days, as for many people accessing their medical records is potentially time critical

attributes.action: Help stop the growing violence and murders of Christians in Nigeria
attributes.background: It is estimated that over 16,000 Christians have been killed in Nigeria since 2015. No group has been brought to justice and the scale of these atrocities keeps rising. We need the UK Government to add pressure on the Nigerian govt. to put a stop to these killings before it escalates to war.
attributes.additional_details:
These are links from local news papers and social media 
https://www.vanguardngr.com/2017/06/will-protect-nigerias-northern-christians/
https://www.persecution.org/2018/02/13/report-claims-16000-christians-killed-nigeria-since-2015/
https://www.spectator.co.uk/2017/02/who-will-protect-nigerias-northern-christians/

attributes.action: Make UK standard parking spaces bigger.
attributes.background: Parking space is a premium in most cities and towns. However, most spaces are barely wider than a vehicle. A UK standard parking space is 2.4m wide, by 4.8m. The average family car is 2.1m x 4.8m. Park perfectly and you get 150mm either side to open a door. This is not enough for most vehicle users.
attributes.additional_details:
You should be able to park your vehicle and get in or out without struggling. You should also not have to worry about potential damage which can often be sustained in your absence. Causing needless cost and loss of earnings, maybe even insurance hikes. Town and city planners have overlooked this for years, as have Supermarkets and retail parks.
It's time, as consumers, that we took a stand and put the onus onto those profiting from our misery.
Your vote could help to change this.
